resource.chars:
V. An account of the case above-mentioned and translated from 
the french by Mr. Zollman. F.R.S.
One Joseph Vasse Inhabitant of Le Thor 
a small town at <s>[text?]<\s> a short league’s distance from Lisle in the 
County of Venaison, aged sixty six years, of a 
robust Constitution, <s>running <\s> who used to travail about <s>the <\s> to Fairs 
and Markets <s>of<\s> in that Country dealing in Corn and 
Cattle, without having ever complained of any 
indisposition, began on 14th of February 1731
to feel in the nighttime some difficulty of making 
water, attended with a smarting about the Glans;
which however did not hinder him from attending his
business as before.
On the 28th of March 1732 the said Vasse 
was seized in the night with a true Ischuria,
which cruelly tormented him. I was sent for 
on the 29th in the evening to <s>sound probe <\s> him, and to 
draw off the Urine <s>off from him <\s>. I drew accordingly 
six Cups each containing one <s>Pound <\s> Pint and a Quarter.
The Patient found <s>himself easy <\s> immediate ease 
and continued without pains or fe<s>a<\s>ver, so that 
he thought himself entirely cured. But the 
night following the pains returned, which made 
him resolve to come to l’Isle to be nearer at hand 
to be <s>sounded probed <\s> sounded. He came on 30th March
